issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://web.de/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fweb.de%2F) ### Comment Username: @Morku > This update notification is some kind fishing to install Firefox with bundled unwanted software. > > I am maintaining someones PC. When always a new Firefox is released, I have to fix his browser, because he has "Firefox for Web.de" installed. He has web.de as homepage. > Even when I tell him, that he doesn't care about updating his browser (it's enabled by default), he probably gets frighten by this Banner and installs it. If you don't carefully read, you get a modified browser. > > This Banner should be treated IMO like some sort of Smartbanner. Even if the purpose sounds good, it is for fishing unskilled users to have Scam installed. > > Install some sort outdated Firefox, e.g.: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/116.0/win64/en-US/Firefox%20Setup%20116.0.exe > An User Agent with changed browserversion might also work. > > The same banner also appears on https://www.gmx.net/ , https://www.gmx.at/ and https://www.gmx.ch/ ### Screenshots

comment.body:
As said, you get the banner with an outdated version of Firefox, e.g. https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/116.0/win64/en-US/Firefox%20Setup%20116.0.exe
This is the official version. However, you will get the Banner anyway that will install "Firefox for Web/Gmx" with unwanted software.

This is similar like using Bing with Chrome and get the "Oh wait, you already have Edge, use that" Banner.

issue.title: Merge multiple `example.js` rules into one rule instead of duplicate rules

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer; - [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed; - [X] This is not an ad/bug report. ### Problem description Hi, why the `/example.js` multiple rules are still not merged into a single rule when there are concatenation rules? Is there any reason for this? It would be good to get knowledge. For example: ```Adblock Filter List /example.js$domain=example1.com|example2.net|example3.org ``` These are a few existing examples in filter list, see:

issue.title: Prune adSlots and PlayerAds too for Youtube

comment.body:
I have commented out `trusted-replace-xhr-response` (https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/388d02d45fdb4d95e137fb3dedf46493326acbb4) because multiple `trusted-replace-xhr-response` causes breakage on `music.youtube.com` (only when logged in), related to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/160538#issuecomment-1706313484

Similar issue was in the case of embedded youtube player, for example - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/160950#issue-1883299696, though I could not reproduce it, so maybe it was a coincidence, but it looks like it stopped occurring after https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/f76d4f6bf30cc169a411244312184dbdbcc4c382

comment.body:

@ryanbr Hello. Could you please take a look?

Please test in user filter
```
.com./$popup,domain=pornhub.com,badfilter
|http*://*?$popup,third-party,domain=pornhub.com,badfilter
```

issue.title: Adguard family DNS incorrectly blocks `telegra.ph`
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS, Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

Irrelevent

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Dangerous site

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox, other (specify in comment below), the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://telegra.ph

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard DNS filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

### About the site

https://telegra.ph is owned by Telegram and can be used to quickly write formatted texts. More details at the announcement here: https://telegram.org/blog/instant-view#telegraph. The site also has an option to report the user-generated content for illegal content, which makes it unreasonable IMO to not block this site. Users of TG might also be affected (not sure though)

### Cloudflare DNS (1.1.1.1) :white_check_mark:
```
$ dig @1.1.1.1 telegra.ph +tls

; <<>> DiG 9.18.18 <<>> @1.1.1.1 telegra.ph +tls
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 4874
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 1232
; PAD: (409 bytes)
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;telegra.ph.			IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
telegra.ph.		23	IN	A	149.154.164.13

;; Query time: 146 msec
;; SERVER: 1.1.1.1#853(1.1.1.1) (TLS)
;; WHEN: Sat Sep 09 18:58:05 IST 2023
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 468

```

### Google DNS (8.8.8.8) :white_check_mark: 
```
$ dig @8.8.8.8 telegra.ph +tls

; <<>> DiG 9.18.18 <<>> @8.8.8.8 telegra.ph +tls
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 46691
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 512
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;telegra.ph.			IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
telegra.ph.		38	IN	A	149.154.164.13

;; Query time: 176 msec
;; SERVER: 8.8.8.8#853(8.8.8.8) (TLS)
;; WHEN: Sat Sep 09 18:59:13 IST 2023
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 55

```

### Adgaurd Default (blocks ads + trackers) :white_check_mark: 
```
$ dig @94.140.14.14 telegra.ph +tls


; <<>> DiG 9.18.18 <<>> @94.140.14.14 telegra.ph +tls
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 25941
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 0
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;telegra.ph.			IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
telegra.ph.		141	IN	A	149.154.164.13

;; Query time: 396 msec
;; SERVER: 94.140.14.14#853(94.140.14.14) (TLS)
;; WHEN: Sat Sep 09 19:01:42 IST 2023
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 55


```

### Adguard non-filtering (same result as above) :white_check_mark: 

### Adguard Family ❌

```
$ dig @94.140.14.15 telegra.ph +tls

; <<>> DiG 9.18.18 <<>> @94.140.14.15 telegra.ph +tls
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 758
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 0
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;telegra.ph.			IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
telegra.ph.		3600	IN	A	94.140.14.35

;; Query time: 413 msec
;; SERVER: 94.140.14.15#853(94.140.14.15) (TLS)
;; WHEN: Sat Sep 09 19:08:03 IST 2023
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 55


```


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
